IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To provide exceptional health care with compassion.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To provide exceptional health care with compassion.
IRS990.Desc: Benson Hospital is a rural hospital that provides medical care on an inpatient outpatient and emergency basis in and around the town of Benson Arizona. The hospital has 22 acute care beds and is designated as a critical access hospital by the State of Arizona. Care provided includes emergency occupational medicine respiratory therapy diagnostic imaging nutrition services laboratory services pharmacy primary care and physical rehabilitation. Care is provided regardless of race creed color or ability to pay.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Farshad Shirazi MD DBA Emergent Health PLLC

SupplementalInformationGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Facility Separate Hospital Facility, 1 - Benson Hospital Corporation. Part V, Section B Line 5
SupplementalInformationGrp.ExplanationTxt: Our Community Connected Health Manager met with various community members from the mayor to volunteers at the foodbank to increase our understanding of the community.

SupplementalInformationGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Facility Separate Hospital Facility, 1 - Benson Hospital Corporation. Part V, Section B Line 6a
Facility Separate Hospital Facility, 1 - Benson Hospital Corporation. Part V, Section B Line 11
SupplementalInformationGrp.ExplanationTxt: The Hospital is addressing the need for good jobs & healthy economy by being one of the largest employers in the area and collaborating with the local school district and community college to provide clinical externships for students. We are addressing the need for mental health and substance abuse issues through offering a behavioral health partner to our patients and training frontline staff for mental health first aid.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization's community benefit report is contained in a report prepared by a Northern Cochise Community Hospital

The hospital improves the health of the community by assisting with free discounted food distribution education events to help inform them on ways to improve and maintain health partnering with schools to assist with students collaborating with a partner to provide free diapers to the community and collaborating participating in many community collaboration activities.

Bad debt expense is based on historical bad debt write-offs by financial pay class i.e. commercial insurance government payors - medicare and medicaid and self-pay. The past performance is used to estimate the monthly revenue and outstanding receivable balance. The estimate is uploaded monthly to reflect actual activity to date. Any discounts to patient bills are included in the bad debt expense since they are billed net of any contractual adjustments or self-pay discounts.
Any bad debt expense where the financial class was Sliding Fee which is the term used for patients under the financial assistance plan.

The allowable costs are based on the medicare cost report which is based on the number of patient days times the cost per diem. All of the shortfall is considered a community benefit as community members were provided services that were not reimbursed to the hospital. Shortfall represents community benefit.
Every patient is informed about the financial assistance program prior to billing and is often reviewed when collection calls are made.
Form 990 is internally prepared by the company's Director of Finance and a draft is provided to the CEO for review. Upon the CEO's approval a copy is provided to the Board.

Conflict of Interest policy is reviewed by the board annually. The policy covers the directors officers committee members or a person related to a such person. A conflict is defined as a situation where an interested person has a beneficial interest or other link to a transaction that would reasonably be expected to exert influence on that person's judgment. Conflicting interest transactions also include transactions involving entities with which an interested person is affiliated persons who control entities with an interested person is affiliated and persons who are general partners principals or employers of an interested person. Interested persons must disclose conflicting interests to the board when and where appropriate and cannot play a direct or indirect role in deliberations of vote on the related matter. Directors or committee members who do not have a conflicting interest with the transaction vote to approve the related transaction.
